page.title: 10CHANGING TIMES OF ARRAN HIGH
page.content: The standard of education in Lamlash has risen considerably from when it was first opened as a secondary school.It was only from 1971 that pupils did not have to make the trip to the Isle Of Bute to study for Higher passes.Until 1971 the school was only able to cope with O_Grade tuition. It is now possible to sit Highers from a choice of English,Music,Art and Design,Food and Nutrition, Biology, Chemistry,Physics,Geography,History, Modern Studies,Technical Drawing and Mathematics.The staff consists of 32 teachers and two laboratory technicians.There is also the possibility of taking sixth year study subjects.
